Description: GE Lighting LLC agreed to settle allegations of hiring discrimination following an investigation by the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs. Under the terms of the agreement, the federal contractor was required to pay $537,000 in back wages and interest to 102 women who were rejected for entry-level attendant positions at the company's Bucyrus facility.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
